titles.title: First Bag Flies Free Act

To amend title 49, United States Code, to make it an unfair or deceptive practice for any air carrier, foreign air carrier, or ticket agent to charge a fee for or accept payment from a passenger on a flight segment for the first piece of checked baggage.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 11/16/2009--Introduced. First Bag Flies Free Act - Makes it an unfair or deceptive practice for an air carrier, foreign air carrier, or ticket agent to charge a fee for or accept payment from a passenger on a flight segment for the first checked bag that: (1) weighs 50 pounds or less; and (2) does not exceed 62 inches.
